Class GameSession

java.lang.Object
model.GameSession
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameSession extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the state of a single gameplay session. This class is serializable, allowing game progress to be saved and loaded in the future. It tracks lives, puzzle pieces, time, and the state of all visited levels.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameSession

      public GameSession()

  • Method Details

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      Stops the session timer and records the final playtime.

    • getElapsedTime

      public long getElapsedTime()
      Gets the total elapsed time for this session.
      Returns:
      The final playtime if the timer is stopped, otherwise the current elapsed time.

    • getTimeLeft

      public long getTimeLeft()
      Returns:
      The amount of time remaining before the game is over, in milliseconds.

    • getLevel

      public Level getLevel(int levelNumber)
      Retrieves a level by its number. If the level has been visited before in this session, it returns the cached version. Otherwise, it loads the level from a file, caches it, and then returns it.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - The number of the level to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The corresponding Level object.

    • updatePlayerLocation

      public void updatePlayerLocation(GameState currentState, Level currentLevel)
      Updates the recorded location of the player within the session.
      Parameters:
      currentState - The player's current GameState.
      currentLevel - The player's current Level, or null if in the elevator.
